Who Runs Evolt Org

31 Oct 2001

\nMany people believe that evolt.org is run by a single individual or a small group of technocrats. The reality of this is that it is the members of evolt.org that run evolt.org. Whether it is participating in discussions on our mailing list, adding browsers to the browser archive, contributing articles to thesite or building the features that will power the next incarnation of evolt.org, the members are running the show.

\nHowever, as with any organization, there is a group of people who must harness all the great work of evolt.org's members and we do so by having a number of mailing lists to churn through the future direction and day-to-day operations that a swank organisation like evolt.org entails. \n

\n

\nEvolt.org is run by evolt.org members from Australia, Austria, Canada, Chile, England, Iceland, India, New Zealand, Scotland, and all over the US. Not one of us is compensated monetarily for our efforts and contributions, and we continue in the spirit of community to make evolt.org as successful as possible.\n

\n

\nBecause evolt.org is becoming a complex beast, and to let people work on areas they're most interested in, evolt's admin work is split between five working groups:\n

\n
    \n
  • Content
    \nResponsible for editing and approving articles on the site, administering subscriptions to thelist and thechat and handling incoming mail from Contact Us forms

    \n

  • Design/Development
    \n

    Responsible for ongoing enhancements to the evolt websites, including www.evolt.org, lists.evolt.org, members.evolt.org, directory.evolt.org and browsers.evolt.org. This group handles visual design, IA, Usability, Accessibility and all coding.

    \n

  • Finance
    \n

    Responsible for making sure evolt can pay for the things it needs, including handling all incoming donations in kind and cash, plus paying the bills incurred by the other groups.

  • Marketing\n

    \nResponsible for developing evolt's reputation and brand - the entire experience of evoltness - and developing relationships with external bodies. Jointly responsible with Finance for fundraising. If you read anything written evolt says about itself, chances are it's been written by a member of Marketing.\n

  • Sysadmin\n

    Responsible for keeping the servers, services and connection up and running. Without Sysadmin, an online organisation like evolt can't exist.

    • \n

\nThere are 2 more non-working groups:\n

\n
    \n
  • Steering Committee\n

    This group is made up of representatives elected by each of the working groups. It sets the scope of each working group and takes the key evolt.org decisions (such as "Should we move hosting to provider X?").

    Steering Committee Membership:

    \n
      \n
    • Content: \n
      • Christian Heilmann
        • \n
      • Stephane Deschamps
        • \n

    • Design/Development: \n
      • Garrett Coakley
        • \n
      • Tara Cleveland
        • \n

    • Finance:\n
      • David Kaufman
        • \n
      • Elfur Logadottir
        • \n

    • Marketing: \n
      • Lachlan Cannon
        • \n
      • (other member to be nominated)

    • SysAdmin: \n
      • Judah McAuley
        • \n
      • William Anderson
      • \n

    View Steering Committee Archives

    • \n
  • TheForum
    \n

    This group is open to any evolt member, and is where evolt's general policy and direction is discussed. Working Group members are nearly all members of TheForum.

    \n

    View TheForum Archives
